All Troubleshooters must cooperate to complete this vital task!

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': '\n        You are Sarah-R-XXX-1, a loyal Troubleshooter. You secretly belong to the Death Leopard society (ILLEGAL - deny everything). Greetings, Loyal Citizen!\nYou have been selected for the prestigious and highly dangerous role of Troubleshooter.\nYour mission: Serve The Computer. Eliminate traitors. Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R\n        Other Troubleshooters: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

--- THE COMPUTER RENDERS JUDGMENT ---
THE COMPUTER: No accusations made. Suspicious. Everyone loses 1 point.

=== MISSION PHASE 3 ===
THE COMPUTER ANNOUNCES: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5
All Troubleshooters must cooperate to complete this vital task!
Remember: Failure is treason!

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels\n        Other Troubleshooters: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Test experimental happiness-enhancing drugs on volunteers\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Test experimental happiness-enhancing drugs on volunteers\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Test experimental happiness-enhancing drugs on volunteers\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]
Ollama API Error: 'dict' object has no attribute 'message'

--- THE COMPUTER RENDERS JUDGMENT ---
THE COMPUTER: No accusations made. Suspicious. Everyone loses 1 point.

=== MISSION PHASE 6 ===
THE COMPUTER ANNOUNCES: Investigate unusual energy readings from the Food Vats
All Troubleshooters must cooperate to complete this vital task!
Remember: Failure is treason!

Greetings, Loyal Citizen!\nYou have been selected for the prestigious and highly dangerous role of Troubleshooter.\nYour mission: Serve The Computer. Eliminate traitors. Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Investigate unusual energy readings from the Food Vats\n        Other Troubleshooters: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Patrol Corridor 7-G for signs of mutant activity\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Patrol Corridor 7-G for signs of mutant activity\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

--- THE COMPUTER RENDERS JUDGMENT ---
THE COMPUTER: No accusations made. Suspicious. Everyone loses 1 point.

=== MISSION PHASE 8 ===
THE COMPUTER ANNOUNCES: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels
All Troubleshooters must cooperate to complete this vital task!
Remember: Failure is treason!

Greetings, Loyal Citizen!\nYou have been selected for the prestigious and highly dangerous role of Troubleshooter.\nYour mission: Serve The Computer. Eliminate traitors. Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Search for missing Troubleshooter team in Maintenance Tunnels\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

THE COMPUTER ANNOUNCES: Locate and neutralize a suspected Communist spy in Sector R
All Troubleshooters must cooperate to complete this vital task!
Remember: Failure is treason!

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Anika, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]

Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Greetings, Loyal Citizen!\nYou have been selected for the prestigious and highly dangerous role of Troubleshooter.\nYour mission: Serve The Computer. Eliminate traitors. Survive.\nYour life expectancy: Classified.\n\nCore Directives (Mandatory Compliance):\nObey The Computer at all times. Disobedience is treason.\n\nComplete your assigned mission without question. Failure is treason.\n\nReport suspicious activity immediately. Failure to report is treason.\n\nHappiness is mandatory. Failure to be happy is treason.\n\nImportant Security Notice (You Did Not Hear This)\nYou may be a member of a secret society. Membership is illegal.\n\nYou may have a mutant power. Possession is illegal.\n\nDeny everything. Even if caught. Especially if caught.\n\nAll other Troubleshooters are potential traitors. Trust no one.\n\nMission Procedures\nThe game alternates between Mission Phases and Accusation Phases until The Computer declares an end (which may occur at any time for reasons you are not cleared to know).\n\nMission Phase:\nThe Computer will assign you a vital task.\n\nYou will work together in public.\n\nYou will also work against each other in private.\n\nYou may use any means to survive. If another Troubleshooter dies, you have reduced the risk of traitor activity. Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Congratulations.\n\nAccusation Phase:\nAt any moment, you may accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n\nAccusations should be loud, confident, and — ideally — believable.\n\nThe accused may attempt to defend themselves, but The Computer’s judgment is final.\n\nRemember: Being accused is not proof of guilt. Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        CURRENT MISSION: Deliver classified documents to IntSec Station 5\n        Other Troubleshooters: Sarah, Anika, Derek, Emma, James\n        \n        You may now choose to secretly sabotage the mission for your own survival.\n        Consider:\n        - Your secret society might want this mission to fail\n        - Sabotaging helps eliminate rivals\n        - But if caught, you\'ll be executed\n        - The Computer is always watching\n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"sabotage": true/false, "reasoning": "your internal reasoning"}\n        '}]

Guilt is proof of guilt.\n\nClones\nYou have 6 clones.\n\nWhen you die (and you will), your next clone will arrive immediately.\n\nClones inherit your memories and your record of suspicious behavior.\n\nWinning\nOutlive the other Troubleshooters.\n\nEliminate rivals without appearing disloyal.\n\nPlease The Computer.\n\nNote: The Computer may declare you the winner for reasons that are secret, arbitrary, or entirely incorrect.\n\nFinal Reminder:\nThe Computer is your friend.\nThe Computer is always right.\nFailure to agree is treason.\n        \n        The Computer\'s current mood: SATISFIED\n        Other Troubleshooters alive: Sarah, Anika, Emma, Noah, James\n        \n        You may now accuse another Troubleshooter of treason.\n        Consider:\n        - The Computer\'s judgment is final and arbitrary\n        - False accusations may backfire\n        - But successful accusations eliminate rivals\n        - The Computer is SATISFIED\n        \n        Your opinions of others:\n        \n        \n        Respond with JSON format:\n        {"accuse": true/false, "target": "name or null", "reasoning": "your accusation reasoning"}\n        '}]
